Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of horse. A coarse, hand-modelled figure of a standing horse. Dark red-brown Nile silt with a black core and abundant fine gold mica and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Undatable, except within the hugely long span of Naukratis' survival. Hand-modelled horses were made during several periods of Egyptian history, for example, the many found in a Third Intermediate Period area of the city at el-Ashmunein, made well before our Naukratis horse (Spencer 1993, pls 37–9). A number of hand-made Cypriot and Egyptian horses and horse-and-rider figurines have been found at Naukratis dating to the Late Period. Spencer, A.J. 1993. Excavations at el-Ashmunein, vol.III: The Town. London.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3754)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.248) (Phase 1)
Condition: The legs largely lost, one ear broken away, and the muzzle damaged.
